articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Poppy Mcpherson, Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Field hospitals in Thai refugee camps, landmine clearance in war zones, and drugs to treat millions suffering from diseases such as HIV are among the programs facing the chop as President Donald Trump contemplates massive cuts to U.S. foreign aid.
articles.title: Trump's freeze on US aid rings alarm bells from Thailand to Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple casualties were feared after a barrier broke at a Hindu religious festival, the Maha Kumbh Mela, in the northern Indian state of Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday, The Hindu newspaper reported, citing news agency Press Trust of India (PTI).
articles.title: Casualties feared after barrier breaks at India's Maha Kumbh festival, media reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Residents in several neighbourhoods reported small arms fire and some loud explosions, particularly close to the airport.
articles.title: Rwanda-backed Congo rebels face pockets of resistance after entering Goma

articles.author: Mohammed Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Three more Israeli hostages are due to be handed over on Thursday by Hamas, in exchange for scores of Palestinian prisoners set for release from Israeli jails.
articles.title: Palestinians return to Gaza City as mediators look ahead to next stage

articles.author: Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Serbian Prime Minister Milos Vucevic resigned on Tuesday, becoming the highest-ranking official to step down amid a wave of anti-corruption protests that have spread across the country.
articles.title: Serbian prime minister quits as anti-corruption protests persist

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine needed broader security guarantees and Russian President Vladimir Putin was not afraid of Europe, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told Fox News in an interview in which he urged U.S. President Donald Trump to be on Ukraine's side.
articles.title: Zelenskiy urges Trump to be on Ukraine's side, says Putin not afraid of Europe

articles.author: Jason Lange, James Oliphant
articles.description: Americans have a dim view of some of President Donald Trump's early barrage of executive orders, including his attempt to do away with so-called birthright citizenship and his decision to rename the Gulf of Mexico, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found.
articles.title: Americans sour on some of Trump's early moves, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: China appears to be building a large laser-ignited fusion research centre in the southwestern city of Mianyang, experts at two analytical organisations say, a development that could aid nuclear weapons design and work exploring power generation.
articles.title: Exclusive: Images show China building huge fusion research facility, analysts say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Tuesday she had been placed under judicial investigation over her country's surprise release of a Libyan police officer wanted by the International Criminal Court.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni under investigation over release of Libyan suspect

articles.author: Nivedita Bhattacharjee
articles.description: India successfully launched into orbit on Wednesday a new navigation satellite aboard a home-grown rocket, strengthening its independent satellite positioning system at a time when space-based technologies are becoming increasingly critical.
articles.title: India sends navigation satellite into orbit on ISRO rocket in landmark launch
